name: Wickland
description: Wickland is an indie arena shooter heavily inspired by classic FPS games of the 90's. Morph into eight deadly beasts and use their own unique abilities, blaze through maps at insane speed to pick up power-ups, and fight your friends or foes in classic maze-like arena maps, just like the good old days.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP3 or Windows Vista Processor: 2.0+ GHZ Single Core Processor Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA 6200+ or ATI Radeon 9600+ Video Card DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 700 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP3 or Windows 7 Processor: 2.4+ GHZ Dual Core Processor Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA 7800GTX+ or ATI x1300+ Video Card DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 1 GB available space

reviews.review_text: GREAT GAME!  Only downfall is the player base- there isn't one........ There, from what I can tell, are a few dedicated players who will be on occasionally, but not many. The only game with people on it had 2 people. Other sources confirm that this game has a very small player base. It deserves more. Once you get into a match it is great.  BUT FEAR NOT. Bots can be added in practice mode, so you can just play against them. In the options you can change their skill, 'normal' level bots are not stupid, they put up a fight, easy I assume are, well easy, but the harder difficulties of bots are very competent, very proficiant in killing you.   10/10 this game was made excellently, great everything, gameplay is great, but could do with more people to kill in multyplayer. But I am content with the bots in practice mode.
Great game itself, scene seems kinda dead though. I'd recommend it if you can get it on sale, not sure it's worth paying the full price for though, simply down to the lack of a playerbase.
Wickland is a quake clone on crack, fun , fast and frags. I would love to have a lan night with all my gamers and play each other. I got it for .99 and it's a fun game!

This game shows A TON of potential.  First of all, I want to congratulate the delevopers for not giving up on this game like most companies do with their Early Access titles.  Anyways, here we go.  Graphics: Not bad, really has the 90's arena vibe and best of all, you don't need a good computer to run this game!  Sound: Eh, it's okay - it gets a bit annoying after a while with the constant 'ooh' and 'ugh'. It seems like there is only one sound for each time your character is hit. 'ooh', 'ugh', it never changes.  Characters: Each character has their own set of little moves and powers but it didn't give me any satisfaction (see gameplay). It seems like the character 'Neymar' doesn't really have any useful attacks - choking himself, or clawing (which only works if your opponent is 3 cm away).  Gameplay: Very, VERY fast-paced - essentially a modern 'Quake'. When I said the attacks didn't give me any satisfaction I meant that to kill someone you have to hit them MANY, MANY times, and you will probably run out of ammo before you actually have a chance to kill them. It feels like there isn't any...POWER...behind the powers. It is extremely hard to aim and hit where you want, especially on the insanely-hard AI. Either Neymar or the Archer guy you start out with are probably the most underpowered.   Multiplayer: Good luck on finding ANY players. I've opened the game about 8 times and have played a total of 49 minutes because I've only seen a total amount of THREE players online - at SEPRATE times. 3 times it would just be me and some other guy in the server, and we just end up leaving because there's nobody else to join and we're sick of the AI.  Overall this game does show a lot of potential and it really could be something if the devs stick with it. I know I bashed Wickland pretty hard in this review, but it really isn't a bad game. (Plus, it's still in Early Access) They just need to slow it down a tad, slow the AI down a bit, work on the mechanics slightly and it would be a much more enjoyable experience.   This is an OK game, but it's not worth $10.99 at all. I really want to see this game be more polular, but in it's current state, I don't think it can happen.

Very past paced, fantasy-medieval style FPS Arena game.  Movement and shooting feels great, bunch of different and nice designed maps, interesting idea of weapons being different characters that you pick up like in other fps arena games.   Game is being slowly developed which means that game is lacking a lot of features. There is no LAN, no BOTs etc.  Anyway, worth picking up while on discount, to have some fun with friends.

This game is one of those weird ideas some one came up with while having a conversation on drugs. Sadly this game should have come out in like 2001, then it would have taken off. However in these crappy gaming times a gem like this is hastily over-looked by most anyone without a hardon for Quake style arena shooters and has almost no community that I can find easily. I heartily recommend this game if you can find some people to play with!! One of the most unique weapon systems I've ever encountered! You don't pick up 'guns' you pick up powerups that are like animals, so when you change weapons you actually change your whole body and become a different monster in a paper-rock-scissors style some-are-better-than-others-for-different-things. You can morph from a crab monster to a werewolf! Sounds really different right? Well it is, give it a chance if you're feeling froggy!!!
Interesting game.
This game is good and interesting. =)
Great game.
servers are dead, playing with bots no fun at all

Quake with a medieavel theme which includes more features, but lacks even more. 'A different experience' for the first half hours, then boring.  Not worth the price. But it has a potential. I hope i see that potential become real.
Wickland is based on '90s FPS arena shooters (Quake 3 and UT)...but the game is just awful.  2/10

Very nice idea, arenas look cool and I enjoy the 90's feel. Too bad servers are very bad so you just end up playing alone if no one of your friends can play with you and you don't want to play on bots. You can't even make server of your own and no LAN support! Don't spend money on this game!
It's a great game but there is just no one to play with. so it's a waste of money

I'm not recommending this game because there isn't enough players or servers. And it's only fun for 1 or maybe 2 matches. And there is many F2P games almost like this and more interesting than this one.
Quake Live is better and this was in my opinion the worst Quake-like Game ever
Don't get me wrong it is a great game but the servers are broken so you can't play online.

Trash attempt at recreating Quake/Unreal Tournament game play unfortunately it actually plays too fast paced and the weapons need serious work it's all pretty much just a sad attempt at some eye candy cash grab and not even a very good one at that save your $1 on 90% off and by Bloody Trapland at least the game play beast the ♥♥♥♥ out of this game.

I figured it'd be bad but i didn't pay enough attention to see it had was just arena multiplayer (which is dead)  You get a fully-auto crossbow and make all sorts of grunting noises every time you switch weapons. This game makes no sense.

If you were tricked into buying this game. First off, uninstall the game. Second off, right click the game in your library and select 'Set Categories...' - then check the box that hides the game in your library... Now you're all set. The game is hidden, uninstalled... never to be touched again. Exactly where it needs to be, in a deep dark dungeon because the developers are a bunch of chumps making money from a game that is pretty broken. GG

This game was so ♥♥♥♥in bad it made me cut my ♥♥♥♥ off. If you're thinking about killing yourself 100% buy this game, it will make you want to do it even more then hopefully you will. ♥♥♥♥ you all i wasted 70p on this ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game
It's impossible to get vac ban in this game. But if it's not - let me know, thank you.

Update: Trading cards were added to Wickdevs, so if you got the game free - you can earn some moneys! If you bought this crap - it might sweeten your disappointment. Also: spent more time walljumping through ugly and badly designed maps while trickshooting bots. So with all the 'creditibility' I earn from that - I hope I have hurt devs enough and drive away people who might now go play fistful of frags or something else actually good. Post comment here if you are offended bro.  Original review: Another example of 'do-you-even-oldschool-bro': Arena FPS with gimmick - your weapons change your look and act as your armor. It has walljump. That's the definition of oldschool. Yeah! 6 maps. Each of them looks awful. Each of them is too big for 1on1 duel. There is no modding support by the way. No workshop, no SDK, nothing, go away please you pesky modder. LAN through console (server through command-line). I don't think anyone would be interested in playing this thing on LAN but still... very user-friendly. Actually even menu is barebones. Devs ain't put much effort into this thing, I don't know why to build anything at all if you care that 'much' of your game. For example controls configuration menu uses only like 1/16 part of screen. Yeah, it's cheap. It even was free with some promotion. It's of decent quality for it's 'free' price I give it that. You may even have 5-10 minutes of fun if your friends have this crap too. Just don't pay for it - you'll feel robbed. Still it's not like anyone would be interested in this pathetic attempt even if it was free. There is s**tton of better arena FPS games. Even free ones. Hell with it, there is ton of better mods with a lot better designed maps. No one plays it and neither should you. You can shoot some bots tho  p.s.: Why does it called Wickland? Is there some deep meaning? Backstory? Some sprawling intergalactic setting behind that thing?

Multiplayer deathmatch with no players.  Honestly the quality of it is questionable anyway. 15 years ago this would have been a free UT mod. The maps I played were uninspired, and samey. The bots were spazzy like UT bots. And overall it felt like a student project. The sound effects sound like they were recorded with a desktop microphone. And the scripting on the weapons / environmental triggers are just tweaks and reskins of stuff that is already in UT.  Except UT has way more in it. And also players.  Oh, and did I mention I had to manually install the directx redist to even get it to run?
